content.body: Never too late to learn on the job :). I think a lot of us (not necessarily speaking for wanderview but at least for myself...) find it easier to review and guide than drive.

content.body:
> <@domenicdenicola:matrix.org> Never too late to learn on the job :). I think a lot of us (not necessarily speaking for wanderview but at least for myself...) find it easier to review and guide than drive.

that is true, and i'd love to try to learn and do this, but as stated, not really priority. well, let me change my reasoning for not being able to do this to: i am not going to have time because next up i have to suffer through implementing indexeddb, and after that i dont want to see another webspec for a while ðŸ™ƒ

content.body: dz85: I encourage you to read https://whatwg.org/faq#living-standard and https://whatwg.org/faq#adding-new-features. We're mostly in the business of steady incremental improvement.

content.body: I was surprised to find out that the `<svg><use>` element is not really specified through fetch or some terms of "navigation". It also does not acknowledging that it is some sort of nested browsing context (or is it not?).

content.body: This is somewhat related to TrustedTypes experiencing bypasses with `<use href="data:...">` and the question whether `data` should make things cross-origin? Discussion is in https://github.com/w3c/webappsec-trusted-types/issues/357 (scroll down)
